org.jetel.component.util

Class CommandBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.component.util.CommandBuilder

  • public class CommandBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for creating command for load utility from string pieces and parameters. Each parameter is one field in array.
    Since:
    10.2.2009

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandBuilder(java.util.Properties properties) 
      CommandBuilder(java.util.Properties properties, char equalChar) 
      CommandBuilder(java.util.Properties properties, java.lang.String switchMark) 
      CommandBuilder(java.util.Properties properties, java.lang.String switchMark, java.lang.String equalMark) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(java.lang.String value)
      Appends given value to the end of command.
      void addAttribute(java.lang.String attrName, int attrValue)
      Adds attribute and it's value (no quoted): attrName=attrValue | --attrName=attrValue for exmaple: port=123
      void addAttribute(java.lang.String attrName, java.lang.String attrValue)
      Adds attribute and it's value (no quoted): attrName=attrValue for exmaple: host=localhost | --host=localhost
      void addAttribute(java.lang.String attrName, java.lang.String attrValue, boolean singleQuoted)
      Adds attribute and it's value: attrName=attrValue or attrName='attrValue' for exmaple: host=localhost | host='localhost' | --host=localhost
      void addAttributeAsTwoAttributes(java.lang.String attrName, int attrValue)
      Adds both attribute and it's value (no quoted) separately: --attrName attrValue for exmaple: -host, localhost | --host, localhost
      void addAttributeAsTwoAttributes(java.lang.String attrName, java.lang.String attrValue)
      Adds both attribute and it's value (no quoted) separately: --attrName attrValue for exmaple: -host, localhost | --host, localhost
      void addAttributeDirect(java.lang.String attrName, java.lang.String attrValue)
      Deprecated. 
      see the note above
      void addBooleanAttribute(java.lang.String attrName, boolean attrValue)
      If attrValue doesn't equal "false" then attrName is added to command.
      boolean addBooleanParam(java.lang.String paramName, java.lang.String switchString)
      If paramName is contained in properties and it's value doesn't equal "false" then param is added to command.
      void addBooleanParam(java.lang.String paramName, java.lang.String switchString, boolean defaultValue)
      If paramName is contained in properties and it's value doesn't equal "false" then param is added to command.
      void addParam(java.lang.String paramName, java.lang.String paramKeyword)
      Adds param and it's value (no quoted) - value is get from properties: paramKeyword=paramValue for exmaple: host=localhost | -host=localhost
      boolean addParam(java.lang.String paramName, java.lang.String paramKeyword, boolean singleQuoted)
      Adds param and it's value - value is get from properties: paramKeyword=paramValue or paramKeyword='paramValue' for exmaple: host=localhost | host='localhost' | -host=localhost
      java.lang.String[] getCommand() 
      java.lang.String getCommandAsString()
      Return command as String, add space between each field.

    • Method Detail

      • addAttributeDirect

        public void addAttributeDirect(java.lang.String attrName,
                      java.lang.String attrValue)
        Deprecated. see the note above
        NOTE: This method was introduced due to hot fix of issue CL-1932. Special characters (StringUtils.specCharToString()) are not converted to string in comparison with former implementation (CommandBuilder.addAttribute()). Method should be removed once the issue "CL-1930 Escape sequences interpretation in CommandBuilder" is solved. This method can be invoked only by MsSqlDataWriter.createCommandLineForLoadUtility() method for 'serverName' attribute. DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD IN OTHER CASES!!! comprehensive re-factorization is necessary first Adds attribute and it's value: attrName=attrValue or attrName='attrValue' for exmaple: host=localhost | host='localhost' | --host=localhost
        Parameters:
        attrName -
        attrValue -
        singleQuoted - decides if attrValue will be single quoted

      • addBooleanAttribute

        public void addBooleanAttribute(java.lang.String attrName,
                       boolean attrValue)
        If attrValue doesn't equal "false" then attrName is added to command. "switchMarkattrName"
        for exmaple: --compress
        Parameters:
        attrName -
        attrValue -

      • addParam

        public boolean addParam(java.lang.String paramName,
               java.lang.String paramKeyword,
               boolean singleQuoted)
        Adds param and it's value - value is get from properties: paramKeyword=paramValue or paramKeyword='paramValue' for exmaple: host=localhost | host='localhost' | -host=localhost
        Parameters:
        paramName - name of parameter used in properties
        paramKeyword - name of parameter used in load utility command
        singleQuoted - decides if attrValue will be single quoted

      • addParam

        public void addParam(java.lang.String paramName,
            java.lang.String paramKeyword)
        Adds param and it's value (no quoted) - value is get from properties: paramKeyword=paramValue for exmaple: host=localhost | -host=localhost
        Parameters:
        paramName - name of parameter used in properties
        paramKeyword - name of parameter used in load utility command

      • addBooleanParam

        public boolean addBooleanParam(java.lang.String paramName,
                      java.lang.String switchString)
        If paramName is contained in properties and it's value doesn't equal "false" then param is added to command. "switchMarkswitchString"
        for exmaple: --compress
        Parameters:
        paramName - name of param in properties
        switchString - name of param in command

      • addBooleanParam

        public void addBooleanParam(java.lang.String paramName,
                   java.lang.String switchString,
                   boolean defaultValue)
        If paramName is contained in properties and it's value doesn't equal "false" then param is added to command. "switchMarkswitchString"
        When paramName isn't in properties and defaultValue==true then it is added too. for exmaple: --compress
        Parameters:
        paramName -
        switchString -
        defaultValue -
